attributes.action: Any parent convicted of a child sexual offence to be stripped of parental rights
attributes.background: As it stands both parents have joint parental rights and responsibilities of their children if born from 2003 whether married or not.
attributes.additional_details: Convicted Paedophiles and sex offenders with children born from 2003 still have legal rights and responsibilities over their children. This needs to change as no parent or guardian should have to fight in a family court to have those right revoked.

attributes.action: Please tell Theresa May to withdraw her invitation to tyrant Prayuth Chan-Ocha
attributes.background:
Theresa May has invited Thai dictator Prayuth to the UK on June 20 and hopes to agree new arms deals.
We are UK-based Thais who want democracy and human rights. Please support our message to May: 
Don’t welcome Prayuth to Britain. Tell him to restore Thai democracy. Don’t sell arms to the junta.
attributes.additional_details:
Prayuth seized power in an illegal coup in 2014, overthrowing elected leader Yingluck Shinawatra. The junta has used dictatorial power to repress human rights, prosecute critics of military rule, ban political activity, censor media, and try dissidents in unfair military courts. 

Prayuth was also army chief in 2010 when the military launched a violent crackdown on pro-democracy protesters. More than 90 people were killed and nearly 2,000 wounded.

attributes.action: Ban cold calling at people’s homes
attributes.background: A neighbour was brutally attacked and murdered in her own home after answering the door to her assailant. It’s common knowledge that conmen use cold calling to steal from vulnerable people and gain access to homes often leading to devastating consequences.
attributes.additional_details: People should not be allowed to sell goods or services door-to-door without an invitation. We need to ban cold calling to protect the elderly and vulnerable by cutting off access for the cruel people that use this as a means of access. Most people now will go online to source builders, windows etc and look for reviews of companies. We do not need people knocking on our homes leaving some scared and open to being subjecting to robberies, fraud and being harmed.

attributes.action: Make beating a horse an offence as it is for all other animals.
attributes.background: Beating any animal viciously is an offence in the UK except for horses ie as in racing.  Why are horses an exception?

attributes.action: Examine the entire policing operation in the UK.
attributes.background: Policing has moved on. Crime is again predominating. Policing is asked to do more with ever decreasing numbers of officers. Yet the only section of the police family that is suffering is the front line. A fundamental change is needed.
attributes.additional_details: There is no longer justification for 43 constabularies with all the expenditure associated with them. We need a major re-think. Budget saved would be used to increase front line officers delivering policingthe through a streamlined, efficient leadership model. Supported financially by the sale of headquarters buildings the service can become more visual as should be the case. The knock on effect would also mean the reduction of Crime Commissioners and their entourage within a refirmed structure.

attributes.action: Erase CCJ immediately from records once debts are fully paid.
attributes.background: A CCJ on record for 6 years can be the end of normal life for most. 6 months career break alone is dangerous, 6 years is destructive. That Mortgages will be lost, homes break under financial burden, people look to emigrate over a £300 registered debt is ludicrous & the judgements too easily applied.

attributes.action: Public Inquiry into the actions of South Yorkshire Police at Orgreave 1984
attributes.background: At Orgreave, South Yorkshire Police ordered officers to charge "a largely peaceful crowd" & evidence given by South Yorkshire Police (SYP) has been described as "the biggest frame-up ever", SYP had a culture of fabricating evidence, which was not corrected by the time of the Hillsborough disaster.

attributes.action: Full funding for Aflibercept, Bevacizumab,Lapatinib,Eribulin, Everolimus
attributes.background: I have cancer and I believe that the drug Bevacizmab would help my treatment and it is not currently funded by the NHS.

attributes.action: Give an alternate route for couples to reach the spouse visa income requirement
attributes.background:
Each year thousands of couples are kept apart due to the strict and unrealistic financial requirements that must be met in order to obtain a UK spouse visa. 

The current requirement is £18,600 per year, this is not a small amount to earn for one individual as 3rd party income is not considered.
attributes.additional_details: This petition proposes that the financial requirement stays at £18,600, however the UK sponsor must only earn £14,966 per year (full time minimum wage). The £14,966 can then be combined with the income of a direct family member to reach the £18,600. After entry to the UK, the alien spouse has 6 months to find a job where the couple can reach £18,600 per year. This allows the government limit to stay in place while having a much fairer system.

attributes.action: Ban balloon manufacture/sale and make mass balloon releases a criminal offence,
attributes.background: Balloons do not go to heaven, when they land the consequences are deadly for wildlife, 70% of the time they end up in oceans.  Animals often mistake them for  food, leading to stomach and intestinal blockages and eventual starvation.
attributes.additional_details:
https://balloonsblow.org/
https://www.ukrivers.net/balloon_fact.html

attributes.action: Require drivers aged 70 + to undergo an annual road safety check and eye exam.
attributes.background: I propose that all drivers aged 70 and over should have to have annual safety assessment by a qualified driving instructor, and an eye examination by an optometrist, both of whom will submit a report to the DVLA to allow them to hold their license for the following twelve months.

attributes.action: End the inequality of Child Tax Credits and Child Benefit after a separation.
attributes.background: After a separation a "non-resident" parent with shared 50/50 caring is not entitled to claim Child Tax Credits easily and fairly under the current system. This is causing children to live half their lives in poverty.
attributes.additional_details: When a child is born 1 parent claims the Child Benefit. At the direct time of separation in a 50/50% contact scenario only the "resident parent" can claim the Child Tax Credit benefit due to being in receipt of the Child Benefit. End the inequality! Non-resident parents and children deserve a fairer system.

attributes.action: For the campaign #askforangela to be a government backed national roll out
attributes.background: A simple code-word campaign for people feeling unsafe on a date. It encourages people to discreetly ask for help by going to the bar and ' Ask for Angela' - a phrase aimed at alerting bar staff to the cry for help so they can help defuse the situation discretely and without fuss.
attributes.additional_details:
A woman has successfully used the ‘Ask for Angela’ safety scheme to remove herself from a difficult situation during a night out.

A number of pubs across the country offer the scheme, which aims to reduce sexual violence and vulnerability by providing men and women with a subtle phrase they can use to get out of uncomfortable or potentially dangerous circumstances.

One pub in Gloucester successfully helped a female patron to do just that.

attributes.action: Increase the Defence Budget to 3% of the GDP (Approx. £80bn/year) by 2025.
attributes.background:
Defence is an important subject.
The Armed Forces require a lot of money to be put towards them, as having the most professional military on the planet isn't cheap.
attributes.additional_details:
Recent budget cuts have had a severe effect on our Armed Forces. Thousands of jobs have been lost, and not enough people are joining.

Our Navy is ever decreasing in size, with barely enough ships to protect the new Queen Elizabeth class carriers, or even men to crew them.
Our Air Force lacks in the modern aircraft we need to defend our great nation.
The Army is in need of new land-systems all the time.

Our current Defence Budget just cannot afford it, especially how it's currently decreasing.

attributes.action: Ban the use of plastic tampon applicators
attributes.background: Like straws, applicator tampons are used once and then thrown away. A lot end up in the oceans harming wildlife and tainting the oceans. Others end up in landfill where they will take 100s of years to break down. There are other types of products available.

attributes.action: Introduce more mental health services for adolescents aged 16-18
attributes.background: In today's society there's an increasing rise in mental health issues in young people, 70% of young people do not receive appropriate resources. Many of these young people will not be able to receive appropriate help and resources as they are lost in the net of being mid 16-18.
attributes.additional_details: There are organisations such as CAMHS, however it is becoming increasingly common that when you reach mid 16-18 years of age you are lost in a net, where the referral will take too long and you have to wait until you're 18 to receive more resources and help. 20% of adolescents will experience a mental health problem, this is constantly increasing with more and more pressures of today's society. Young people need the support of trained professionals, mental health should not be pushed aside and they have a right to appropriate resources and should not have to wait until being 18.

attributes.action: Give users of mobile phones while driving a 3 month driving ban.
attributes.background: Every day I walk my dogs I see many drivers using their mobile phones. Clearly the 6 points and £200 fine have not had the desired effect to make people stop using phones while driving.
attributes.additional_details: I firmly believe that a three month driving ban would help greatly stop drivers using phones as they drive. Before I retired it would have been very difficult for me to get to work without my car as no public transport was available. If others were put in this position then it will make them think before using the phone, hopefully!

attributes.action: Make the locking of school toilets during class time illegal.
attributes.background: It is an awful process for teenage females who require access to the nearest toilet and for everyone who has medical conditions that require quick access to the toilet. Also, using the toilet is a necessary process. Requiring to find a teacher is not appropriate!
attributes.additional_details: Finding an appropriate member of staff with a key is a time-consuming process and isn't fast. Therefore under 'The Workplace (Health, Safety and Welfare) Regulations 1992' - Regulation 21 #188 - 'Sufficient toilet and washing facilities should be provided to allow everyone at work to use them without unreasonable delay.' [http://www.hse.gov.uk/pUbns/priced/l24.pdf] and Regulation 21 #190 in the same Act, 'Facilities should be located so they are convenient...' I believe locking school toilets fails to meet the criteria and these same rights should be applied to students. Having to find a member of staff, without knowing where they would be, takes time and I, with many others, argue that it is an 'unreasonable delay'!

attributes.action: Recall of MPs Act to include failure of MPs to abide by Constituents’ wishes
attributes.background: The Recall of MPs Act 2015 is very limited in scope. It only covers when an MPs is sentenced to a prison term or is suspended from the House for at least 21 sitting days.  It should be extended to allow for the recall of MPs that ignore the wishes of the majority of their constituents.
attributes.additional_details: A third reason for the Recall of an MP should include acting contrary to their Election Manifesto, by for example voting against something they promised, and acting contrary to the wishes of the majority of their constituents as expressed in a national or local referendum.

attributes.action: make wrongly reporting someone to a law enforcement agency a criminal offence
attributes.background: At present people who deliberately mislead the police by making false accusations may be prosecuted for a number of offences such as wasting police time or attempting to pervert the court of justice. There is no similar offence where malicious claims are made to other law enforcement agencies.
attributes.additional_details: There are regular prosecutions for wasting police time. Where a person acting maliciously reports his victim to the local authority, the RSPCA, trading standards, health and safety executive, the benefits agency, etc. the effects on the victim can be equally distressing, as well as costly in time and money for both the victim and the investigating agency. Civil redress would usually involve the High Court with a defamation action or similar and is beyond the means of many victims.

attributes.action: Guard those with health problems from malicious messages (epilepsy/ strobe GIFs)
attributes.background: People with health conditions have to take precaution in everyday life, however, if they are specifically targeted via social media or message then there is nothing place to protect them against this. We, the undersigned, call on the Houses of Parliament to review this and make necessary changes.
attributes.additional_details: On 5th February 2018, a person posted a Strobe GIF to an epilepsy group leaving several people ill and one in hospital. Her profile states that she is based in the UK. People in the UK have been to the police regarding this. The police have wanted to do something about this but current UK legislation does not cover this, it does not even fall under "malicious communication".

attributes.action: Govt to increase funding for UK space programme, launch technology and spaceport
attributes.background: With the recent successful launch of the Electron rocket, developed in and launched from New Zealand, the UK is at risk of being left behind in the development of space tech. This petition calls on the Government to expedite and properly fund UK space ambitions including Skylon and a UK spaceport.
attributes.additional_details:
-UK Space Agency funding for 2016/17 was £371 million which is 0.05% of £772 billion total govt spending in the same year.
-Small nation of New Zealand successfully developed Electron rocket satellite launcher.
-Spin-off technologies associated with space programmes will benefit UK economy with high-tech jobs.
-21st century race for low-cost launchers, UK at risk of being left behind by other countries.

attributes.action: Clamp down on sexual harassment in clubs with nationally enforced regulations
attributes.background: Sexual harassment is an endemic issue faced by women on nights out in this country. It is disgraceful in 2018 that persistent unwanted attention and groping are just part of going out for women. Clubs and live music venues must appoint trained staff inside their premises to combat this issue
attributes.additional_details: My suggestion is either existing staff are redistributed or new bouncers appointed to monitor the inside of the clubs. These bouncers would be easily visible so women can report any perpetuators without trouble and feel more safe and comfortable on nights out. Funding required in some cases could be provided by the government

attributes.action: NHS to provide badges for chronically/long term ill people for public transport
attributes.background: Currently NHS doesn’t provide people with chronic illnesses such as endometriosis and long term illnesses which have an impact on the persons quality of life badges for public transport. People with these conditions are extremely poorly would struggle to stand if there were no seats.

attributes.action: Hold Referendum in Scotland, to end devolution and return control to Westminster
attributes.background: Due to the actions of the Scottish government, ruining Scotland's economy and creating severe division in the populace, there is an increasing opinion that the welfare of the Scottish people could be better served by the Westminster Government.

attributes.action: Moped riders must have a full license. Not a provisional one.
attributes.background: Recently the number of mopeds thefts on main streets has increased drastically. This is primarily caused by teenagers on mopeds snatching phones while riding. This is enhanced by the fact that to get a moped you only need to have a provisional license which is exceedingly easy to obtain.
attributes.additional_details: The number of thefts in London has skyrocketed in recent years. Within the twelve months leading up to June 2017 the metropolitan police recorded 16,158 thefts on mopeds alone. The majority of these thefts is by teenagers with learner plates; who require no experience or background checks before being able to ride. We propose that all people wishing to obtain a moped require a full license.

attributes.action: Add the topic of eating disorders to the national PSHE curriculum
attributes.background: In the UK, 1.6 million people suffer from an eating disorder. This is an issue that often affects students, especially teenagers from 14-25. We believe that is often not talked about so to raise awareness and break the stigma we want it to be added to the national PSHE curriculum.
attributes.additional_details:
6.4% of Adults displayed evidence of having an eating disorder. 
Children as young as 6 have been known to have an eating disorder.
Being able to spot the symptoms in a friend or family member is extremely important and with growing numbers of eating disorders in the UK, it is essential to equip the youth with the right knowledge.

LEARN MORE: 
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/eating-disorders/
https://www.mind.org.uk/information-support/types-of-mental-health-problems/eating-problems/

attributes.action: Suspend the lease rental rule change from 130g/km emissions to 110g/km ASAP
attributes.background:
New lease rental restriction bands from April 2018 are negatively impacting company new car sales contributing to job losses across the UK.
Employees paying company car tax support’s the Treasury coffers by millions of pounds, but is in serious decline due too many alterations.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.businesscarmanager.co.uk/lease-rental-restrictions/
https://www.businesscarmanager.co.uk/company-car-tax-to-change-over-to-new-wltp-emission-rules-from-april-2020/
https://www.businesscarmanager.co.uk/new-202021-company-car-tax-bands-favour-ultra-low-emission-vehicles/
https://www.businesscarmanager.co.uk/800000-drivers-face-70m-diesel-company-car-tax-hike/
https://www.businesscarmanager.co.uk/800000-drivers-face-70m-diesel-company-car-tax-hike/

attributes.action: 'None of the above' as option on ballot paper
attributes.background:
Party Politics can often be seen as a 'Least worst option'.
If we had the option on the ballot paper to indicate 'none of the above' then this positive act would be reflected in the turnout .
attributes.additional_details: The strength of a democracy is measured, in part, by the turnout at elections. This option would increase the intelligence as to what the electorate view of politicians really looks like. As opposed to voting for 'the least worst option'.

attributes.action: Create a scheme that encourages those receiving state benefits to litter pick
attributes.background: As we know from recent media attention, litter is blighting our country and wildlife, and the only way to clear it up is to pick it up. The scheme would not only do this, but also give participants a sense of achievement and responsibility, perhaps encouraged by a reward.
attributes.additional_details: Further consideration should be made for the armed forces, whilst not engaged in military action, to contribute manpower to the scheme.

attributes.action: Increase the age limit to 25 to buy alcohol.
attributes.background: On February 15th 2018 my little brother lost his life aged only 27 years old. He was an alcoholic and fought ferociously to overcome his addiction. I work in retail and I have to challenge anyone who appears to be under 25. So why not just make it legal to be 25 or older??

attributes.action: Veterinary surgeons from outside the UK sit the statutory MRCVS examinations.
attributes.background: Non EU veterinary surgeon have to sit the MRCVS examinations some of them from more medically advanced countries than the UK. EU vets don’t have to sit this exam, but should, it would standardise the level of competency in veterinary surgeons allowed to practice in the UK.

attributes.action: Make it statutory requirement for schools to consult parents about GCSE re-marks
attributes.background: Pupil failed GCSE by 1 mark. School said exam sent for re-mark. Without parent consultation, school only requested 1 component of exam be re-marked. We assumed whole exam was re-marked and would have requested this if had been asked. Extra mark not found & deadlines closed to get other paper marked.
attributes.additional_details: Schools are making decisions about GCSE re-marks without consulting parents as the JCQ Guidance does not state they must consult parents in decisions. In this case the School negligently sent a component for a re-mark that had met the grade boundary for a pass and did not send the component that needed 1 more mark for a pass despite this component being worth 60% of the mark. Exam board have confirmed that there were more marks on the unsent component. School should have sent both to find 1 mark

attributes.action: Issue legal guidance to councils on the eligibility for a disabled travel pass
attributes.background: People applying for a disabled persons pass are being asked for evidence of having had a drivers licence refused on medical grounds, even when they have never applied for a licence. This has happened to many people including myself and others with epilepsy and it’s not acceptable.
attributes.additional_details:
The Transport Act 2000 says you are eligible if you would be refused a driving licence due to physical fitness, IF you ever applied. The practice of demanding a refusal letter is therefore not correct, as the law does not say you have to have applied for a licence. 

Some authorities now accept a doctor’s letter, but a person has to get this by appointment with a specialist, which can cost up to £200. Clear and legally binding guidance must be issued to all local authorities so that they understand what the law actually says and stop denying disabled people what they are legally entitled to.

attributes.action: Provide gym access to all who make national insurance contributions.
attributes.background: Our wonderful NHS is under constant pressure to provide care in our times of need. Targeting healthier living whilst we are able, our times of need may reduce. Some of the costs to becoming healthier should be eradicated and the emphasis placed on exercise becoming an expectation in adult life.
attributes.additional_details: I propose government funded gyms to all who make national insurance contributions. With funds contributed between employer, employee and government. Health is just as important as your pension, and an investment into personal health can only pay us all back. There are many reasons exercise benefits our physical and mental health.

attributes.action: Urge the UN to refer Southern Cameroons (SC) impasse to the ICJ.
attributes.background: There are serious human rights violations taking place in the Anglophone-speaking areas of Cameroon including killings, arrests, torture, disappearances, rape and the razing of whole villages after protests against assimilation. The SC impasse must be referred to the ICJ to solve this crisis.
attributes.additional_details:
In 1961, instead of properly decolonising SC, Britain and the United Nations effectively annexed SC to RC. After unjustly ruling out full independence for SC, the self rule envisaged by UNGA Res 1608 (XV) of 21/04/61 in a federation of two states equal in status was never properly implemented. Today, our Anglo-Saxon educational, legal, economic and socio-cultural systems are under attack by RC assimilationists. 

We want the ICJ to rule in favour of a referendum for us to determine our future.

attributes.action: Mandy’s Law:  “Carers' Charter", Supporting Carers mainly in the Home
attributes.background: Support carers and their families caring at home. More financial and physical support to help relieve the enormous stress and strains put on their lives. I have been a carer three times during a forty year period and personally seen and endured this most destructive way of life caring can often be.
attributes.additional_details:
Carers Allowance increase to £95pw and free from income assessment
Carers in receipt of a State Pension must also qualify for Carers Allowance .
Mortgage Interest allowance increase up to £300000
Up to six hours free home care to give Carers time to shop and rest
Return Community Care back into the hands of the NHS
Free prescriptions for all full time Home Carers
Free respite care to provide time for Carers education and time out
Full grants for ex child carers to move on to College / University

attributes.action: Fund research into carbohydrate polymers as an alternative to plastic
attributes.background: As you are aware, in the UK we create tonnes of plastic waste daily and this is becoming an increasing problem. We need to cut down on the plastic we are using. To overcome this, we can use carbohydrate polymers (cellophane) but the problem is there is not enough funding to support research into it.

attributes.action: Ban Concentrated Animal feeding Operations (CAFO) in the UK
attributes.background: CAFOs are common in the US, but are now beginning to appear in the UK. These huge industrial farms are inhumane and should not be allowed in this country. We believe they should be banned on animal welfare grounds.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/amp.theguardian.com/environment/2018/may/29/revealed-industrial-scale-beef-farming-comes-to-the-uk

https://www.thebureauinvestigates.com/stories/2017-07-17/intensive-numbers-of-intensive-farming

www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/the-controversial-mega-dairies-that-alarm-campaigners-and-divide-a-struggling-sector-of-british-a6744511.html%3famp

www.telegraph.co.uk/pets/news-features/does-uk-really-want-mega-farms/amp/

attributes.action: Convert & retain The European Convention on Human Rights (ECHR) into U.K. law
attributes.background: After Brexit, the European Convention, and the Human Rights Act which enshrines it in UK law, will be more important than ever. They will remain the most fundamental safeguard against abuses of human rights in the UK. This needs to be protected and converted to U.K. law before it’s too late!

attributes.action: Schools to teach anti crime and anti gang culture within schools.
attributes.background: With the constant rise in gang related death and crime it’s time to make a difference. Schools should teach anti crime and anti gang culture as early as junior school. We all need to work together to make a difference.
attributes.additional_details:
No parent wants to hear their child is the victim of crime bullying or hate, but worse still no one wants that knock at the door to say their child has died as a victim of it! 
Stop it before it starts we need to stamp out the whole gang culture that is rapidly growing within our schools and streets.
Children become involved due to peer pressure and it becomes a case of be a bully or be a victim! It has to stop.
Schools to clamp down and teach strict anti gang bullying and crime in schools.

attributes.action: Stop including student loans as “income” for benefits calculations
attributes.background:
We are calling upon the government to stop penalising those who are committed to making themselves more employable by studying for Higher Education qualifications.

A student loan must be paid back (with interest). It is not a grant - and therefore should not be considered as income.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently in the UK, those in receipt of a student loan have it included as “income” when benefits are calculated, and it can affect their entitlement.

Part-time students are particularly at risk; should they find themselves temporarily unable to work, they may not be eligible for the same financial assistance as another person in exactly the same position as them who is not in part-time study.

For more information on benefits that are affected by student loan: https://www.turn2us.org.uk/Benefit-guides/Student-Support/How-does-student-support-affect-benefits

attributes.action: Make rail companies guarantee a guard or security person is on every train.
attributes.background: Merseyrail is to introduce new Driver-Only Operated trains. They only guarantee to have a second person on trains after 8 pm. Many antisocial and criminal incidents take place at other times of day. Trains should have a second person patrolling to maintain order, check tickets and help passengers.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2014, Merseyrail spokeswoman Alice Owen said: “The safety of passengers is Merseyrail’s absolute priority,..." (reported in Liverpool Echo). This cannot be achieved without personnel on trains to ensure passenger safety.

If a passenger operates the alarm handle, there needs to be someone available to render assistance. The driver cannot do this. Without a second person on the train, the driver would have to go to the next station before stopping the train. This could make matters worse.

attributes.action: Stop the practice of charging self funding OAPs higher care rates than councils
attributes.background: Self funding residential care or nursing pensioners subsidise the fees for  council patients by hundreds of pounds per week for exactly the same care. All fees should be transparent and equal for all clients. Councils must pay more, private funders should pay the equivalent rate to ensure fairness.
attributes.additional_details:
Financial Times Article:
https://www.ft.com/content/6c61fa30-f1dc-11e6-8758-6876151821a6

AGE UK report:
https://www.ageuk.org.uk/Documents/EN-GB/Press%20releases/behind_the_headlines_care_homes_oct2016.pdf?dtrk=true

Express Article:
https://www.express.co.uk/comment/expresscomment/723552/Wrong-sensible-savers-to-subsidise-care-elderly-old-age-saving-self-funding

attributes.action: The creation of Sedentary Behaviour Guidelines for the Early Years.
attributes.background: In today’s world there are many trends emerging, which mean children are starting in school underdeveloped physically, emotionally and mentally. We are calling for the government to create a set of Sedentary Behaviour Guidelines for the Early Years (aged 0–4 years) to help combat this.
attributes.additional_details: These national guidelines are in response to a call from health and health care professionals, child care providers, and fitness practitioners for guidance on sedentary behaviour in the early years. There is a strong relationship between sedentary behaviour (predominantly screen time) and health indicators (healthy body weight, bone and skeletal health, motor skill development, psychosocial health, cognitive development, and cardio-metabolic disease risk factors).

attributes.action: Reduce the price of British citizenship for children from £973 to less than £600
attributes.background: The price for British citizenship for children is currently £973, and without this they can't vote or claim student loans. The Home Office makes over £500 profit for each application and this makes many families unable to afford citizenship. The government are putting a price on democracy.
attributes.additional_details:
These children will, later in life, pay taxes as a normal citizen would, but will not benefit in the same way.

As well as this, over 3,000 children that do apply, are denied the citizenship and not refunded the £973 fee.

The right to these has been given to these children by parliament, but currently they are being sold by the home office.

To find out more about the issue, you can read this article:

https://www.vice.com/en_uk/article/534zx8/the-british-born-kids-who-cant-afford-to-be-british

attributes.action: The right to register with two GPs for students studying away from home
attributes.background: Currently in the UK, you can only register to one GP (General Practitioner) at a time. People tend to register to the one nearest to their home address, but what if you're constantly going back and forth between two addresses? This is a problem students studying away from home have to face.
attributes.additional_details:
During each year of study, students receive 3 main holidays, this includes 3-4 weeks at Christmas and Easter and almost 3 months summer holiday. It is not uncommon to need health treatment during these periods, however, receiving the care needed can be a nightmare!

Not all GPs offer temporary registration, imagine the hassle of constantly having to re-register between two GPs. This also causes unnecessary inconvenience for GPs who constantly have to send patients files and data back and forth.

attributes.action: Base income tax on combined household income for a fair tax system
attributes.background: The current tax system places the highest tax burden by far on single-earner households and many single-earner families are sliding towards poverty due to the unfair tax system while single individuals without children enjoy some of the lowest tax rates of the western world
attributes.additional_details:
The current tax system is based on taxing individuals without taking into account how many additional people such as children depend on that income. It also severly punishes mothers who stay at home, despite research demonstrating that this is the best for young children.
The fairest way to support families is by taxing combined household income. This will also eliminate the unfairness of the High Income Child Benefit Charge threshold, where single-earner families loose the benefit with much lower income than double-earner families.
A tax system that is based on the combined household income is common sense and is the standard in most countries in the western world.
https://www.telegraph.co.uk/women/mother-tongue/8365211/Britain-worst-place-for-tax-burden-on-single-earner-families.html

attributes.action: Permit all public universities to test cannabis for medical use
attributes.background: Cannabis is widely believed to have broad medical applications, and there is solid evidence to support some of these. We cannot know the true extent without research. It seems obvious that the current restriction is based on ideology rather than evidence, and this stance is academically unacceptable
attributes.additional_details: Cannabis has been shown to improve the endurance of cancer patients and to improve the experiences of those with chronic pain.  Cannabis has also been shown to be minimally addictive and minimally harmful to health, whilst the debate over its social detriments has contained more heat than light.  The way to put this to bed, one way or the other, is to let the academics test it and find out exactly what it does.  We permit tests on other classes of drugs including opiates, why not cannabis?

attributes.action: Increase highway maintenance funding to make the roads safe to use
attributes.background: Across the country, roads are in a dangerous state of disrepair. Many signs are dirty, broken or obscured by foliage. Road surfaces are badly potholed. It's likely that this neglect has contributed to deaths and injury. Clearly highway maintenance urgently requires a significant increase in funding.
